intro: Garcinia brassii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its ornamental yellow flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Garcinia brassii is valued for its ecological role and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental beauty.
